unnormalised: Local man, identified only as "Bhai" by neighbours, saves stray dog from a rogue auto-rickshaw on 10th Main Road yesterday. Witnesses report that "Bhai," previously known only for his impeccable chai-making skills and expert Bollywood dance moves at Diwali parties, displayed surprising agility, dodging traffic like a seasoned pro.
normalised: Local man, identified only as "Bhai" by neighbors, saves stray dog from a rogue auto-rickshaw on tenth Main Road yesterday. Witnesses report that "Bhai," previously known only for his impeccable chai-making skills and expert Bollywood dance moves at Diwali parties, displayed surprising agility, dodging traffic like a seasoned pro.

unnormalised: Eyewitness accounts claim "Bhai" shouted, "Arre, oye rickshaw-wale, kya kar raha hai?!" before scooping up the bewildered canine, now affectionately nicknamed "Lucky." Apparently, Lucky owes "Bhai" big time, maybe even a lifetime supply of biscuits. One particularly gossipy aunty mentioned that "Bhai" always had a soft spot for street animals, despite his tough exterior.

unnormalised: The incident has made "Bhai" an instant local hero, surpassing even the fame of "Sharmaji ka beta" who topped his IIT entrance exam. Some are even suggesting he be officially addressed as "Mr. Saviour of Strays." However, "Bhai" remains humble, stating, "It's just a small thing, yaar. Anyone would have done it." Though insiders claim that "Bhabhi ji," has been heard addressing him as "My Superhero" all day!
